[p][b]Visual acuity enhancement[/b] is a heightening of the clearness and clarity of vision. This results in the visual details of the external environment becoming sharpened, to the point where the edges of objects are perceived as extremely focused, clear, and defined. The experience of acuity enhancement can be likened to bringing a camera or projector lens that was slightly blurry into focus. At its highest level, a person may experience an enhancement in their ability to observe and comprehend their entire visual field and peripheral vision simultaneously. This is in contrast to the default sober state, where a person is only able to perceive the small area of central vision in detail.[ref to="1" /][/p]

[p]Visual acuity enhancement is often accompanied by other coinciding effects such as [int-link to="/effects/colour-enhancement"]colour enhancement[/int-link] and [int-link to="/effects/increased-pareidolia"]increased pareidolia[/int-link].[ref to="2" /][ref to="3" /] It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to="/summaries/psychedelics/visual"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. However, it can also occur to a lesser extent under the influence of certain stimulants, nootropics, and [int-link to="/summaries/dissociatives"]dissociatives[/int-link], such as MDMA, piracetam, aniracetam, or 3-MeO-PCP.[/p]

This is in contrast to the default sober state, where a person is only able to perceive the small area of central vision in detail.[ref to=\"1\" /][/p]\n\n[p]Visual acuity enhancement is often accompanied by other coinciding effects such as [int-link to=\"/effects/colour-enhancement\"]colour enhancement[/int-link] and [int-link to=\"/effects/increased-pareidolia\"]increased pareidolia[/int-link].[ref to=\"2\" /][ref to=\"3\" /] It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to=\"/summaries/psychedelics/visual\"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. However, it can also occur to a lesser extent under the influence of certain stimulants, nootropics, and [int-link to=\"/summaries/dissociatives\"]dissociatives[/int-link], such as MDMA, piracetam, aniracetam, or 3-MeO-PCP.[/p]"}]

[{"type":"string","value":"[p]It is thought that a fundamental feature of information-processing dysfunction in both hallucinogen-induced states and schizophrenia-spectrum disorders is the inability of these people to screen out, inhibit, filter, or gate irrelevant stimuli and to attend selectively to more important features of the environment.[ref to=\"4\" /][ref to=\"5\" /][ref to=\"6\" /][/p]\n\n[p]The CSTC model of the brain posits that the thalamus plays a key role in controlling or gating external sensory information to the conscious faculties, and is thereby fundamentally involved in the regulation of a person's awareness and attention.[ref to=\"7\" /][ref to=\"8\" /][ref to=\"9\" /][ref to=\"10\" /] The interruption of psychedelics to these neural pathways that inhibit the sensory gating systems[ref to=\"11\" /][ref to=\"12\" /] may result in an enhanced availability of sensory information which is normally filtered out by these systems. This process is likely also involved in the various visual, tactile, and auditory enhancements that commonly occur when under the influence of a psychedelic experience.[/p]"}]

[p]It is thought that a fundamental feature of information-processing dysfunction in both hallucinogen-induced states and schizophrenia-spectrum disorders is the inability of these people to screen out, inhibit, filter, or gate irrelevant stimuli and to attend selectively to more important features of the environment.[ref to="4" /][ref to="5" /][ref to="6" /][/p]

[p]The CSTC model of the brain posits that the thalamus plays a key role in controlling or gating external sensory information to the conscious faculties, and is thereby fundamentally involved in the regulation of a person's awareness and attention.[ref to="7" /][ref to="8" /][ref to="9" /][ref to="10" /] The interruption of psychedelics to these neural pathways that inhibit the sensory gating systems[ref to="11" /][ref to="12" /] may result in an enhanced availability of sensory information which is normally filtered out by these systems. This process is likely also involved in the various visual, tactile, and auditory enhancements that commonly occur when under the influence of a psychedelic experience.[/p]

It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to=\"/summaries/psychedelics/visual\"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. [/p]"}]

This results in the visual details of the external environment becoming sharpened, to the point where the edges of objects are perceived as extremely focused, clear, and defined. The experience of acuity enhancement can be likened to bringing a camera or projector lens that was slightly blurry into focus. [/p]

[p]Visual acuity enhancement is often accompanied by other coinciding effects, such as [int-link to="/effects/colour-enhancement"]colour enhancement[/int-link] and [int-link to="/effects/increased-pareidolia"]increased pareidolia[/int-link]. It is most commonly induced under the influence of mild dosages of [int-link to="/summaries/psychedelics/visual"]psychedelic[/int-link] compounds, such as LSD, psilocybin, and mescaline. [/p]
I designed it this way myself
At home while talking to my girlfriend via skype
At home with my flatmate who took a similar dosage.
At first at home, later in a city park
I saw an angry god-like figure made of clouds glaring down at me
At home and walking around Madison, Wisconsin
At home with my friend who is also tripping
Nexuswalk - A beautiful mix of DXM and 2C-B
Guanfacine 3mg, Buspar 30mg x2, Quiviviq 25mg, Folic Acid, Multi Vitamin.
You do not need to understand
Cliff top of seaside town, backing on to a national park
